content.description: Starts on slightly sloped rail about face height, move right to large side pull and move up.
content.location: East Side of the boulder and Right of the roof

content.description: Sit start low follow the obvious line of crimps up the middle of the SW face. Head straight up and top out slightly left.
content.location: Obvious line of small crimps heading directly up SW face. (5 feet to the left of bust a move.)

content.description: Blocky route located on the west face. Stand start on good flat holds on the right side dark lines. Head straight treading slightly left up to the peak of the boulder and top out. Follows good holds the whole way up if the hold is bad you are probably off route.
content.location: West side of the boulder. Located on the dark line on the right hand side.

content.description: High start right hand on knob and left on good edge. Move up and out on edges  and arete. Traverses right slightly.
content.location: Located on the west facing side of the boulder. It starts near the left hand arete.

content.description: Starts under the roof on the corner of the ledge. Moves directly out the roof using the jug. Holds on the face are nearly non-existant. A crux dyno, up and left, with a nasty swing guards access to the top. Not easy at all, but even a bit harder if you are short.
Start under left side of roof, left hand on the arete and right hand on crimp, start slapping and hookin.
Start a the back of the cave climb through 2-3 powerful moves into the start of open for business. Instead of heading up the roof, pull directly up onto slab using slopers and some foot trickery.
content.location: Starts in the back of cave

content.description:
Starts in the back of the cave 2-3 powerful moves place you at the start of Open for business. Climb through open for business and top out.  The power moves at the beginning create a pumpy good time.

Power endurance V8 = V9ish.
content.location: Starts in the back of cave on broken crack.

content.description: Start where Closing time begins. Stay low under the roof the entire way across. On the far right side of the cave exit by tossing from crimps to jug ledge and top out windmill.

Begin in the back of the cave on the right-side. Climb directly out of the roof using the large jug then slopers on the lip. A tricky encounter with a side pull and a slimper lock-off allows access to a high crimp then Jug.
content.location: Right side of roof. Start low at the back and climb out towards the river.

content.description: Starts on Bust A Move but instead of throwing out left, mantle the lip to the right and finish up the slab.
Low start hands matched on good edge. Feet are found under the roof. Move up to hidden crimp with right hand leads to a big throw to flat angled edge then straight up and top out.
content.location: Located on the east face of the boulder.

content.description: Start matched on jug. Throw up right then head to the top.
content.location: Route is located on the north facing side of the boulder. If starts on the dark line on the left side of the face.

content.description:
Starts between the two dark lines on the north face.

The starting holds are two gastons about shoulder height. Head straight up staying between the dark lines. The crux is the first move.
content.location: Route is located between the dark lines in the center of the north face.

content.description:
This boulder is the best boulder within 10 minutes of Cedar City So eliminates are bound to be created.  It climbs well for an eliminate and if you have done the other problems this one is a good one to do.

Shares starting hold with Bust a Move. Find the feet then throw right hand up to a really slopey edge. Foot trickery enables you to reach 3 feet left to a gaston. Right-hand cross to a poor pinch-crimp. Left then moves to a good sharpish crimp. Head left and up to top out on large holds above Remember To Brush.
content.location: On SW face, shares start with Bust a Move. Tops out in same location as Remember to Brush.
